alert.note: Alert for Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 5:38PM EDT until June 13 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Southwest Ohio and West Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Southwest Ohio, Butler and Warren. In West Central Ohio, Preble. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 538 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Mason, Lebanon, Sharonville, Monroe, Trenton, Franklin, South Middletown, West Chester, Camden, Seven Mile, Williamsdale, Wetherington, Four Bridges, Olde West Chester, Hunter, Kings Island and South Lebanon.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
